metrics.name: Net Interest Margin (NIM)
metrics.description: Measures the difference between the interest income generated by a financial institution and the amount of interest paid out to depositors, relative to its average interest-earning assets. It indicates the profitability of a bank's core lending and borrowing activities.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Interest Revenue - Interest Expenses) / Average Interest-Earning Assets
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for financial services
metrics.business_value: Enables financial services organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Return on Equity (ROE)
metrics.description: Measures the rate of return on the ownership interest (shareholders' equity) of the common stock owners. It indicates how much profit a company generates for each dollar of shareholders' equity.
metrics.calculation_formula: Net Income / Shareholder Equity
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for financial services
metrics.business_value: Enables financial services organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Loan-to-Deposit Ratio
metrics.description: Compares a bank's total loans to its total deposits. It indicates a bank's liquidity and how much of its deposits are being funded by loans. A higher ratio means less liquidity.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total Loans / Total Deposits
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for financial services
metrics.business_value: Enables financial services organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Cost of Funds
metrics.description: Represents the interest expenses incurred by a financial institution to acquire the capital it uses for lending and other operations. It's a key determinant of profitability.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total Interest Expense / Average Interest-Bearing Liabilities
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for financial services
metrics.business_value: Enables financial services organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Non-Performing Loans (NPL) Ratio
metrics.description: Measures the percentage of a bank's loan portfolio that is not generating interest or principal payments. It's a critical indicator of asset quality and credit risk.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total Non-Performing Loans / Total Gross Loans
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for financial services
metrics.business_value: Enables financial services organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Regulatory Capital Ratio (e.g., Common Equity Tier 1 Ratio)
metrics.description: Measures a bank's core equity capital against its total risk-weighted assets. It indicates the bank's ability to absorb losses and its overall financial stability as per regulatory requirements.
metrics.calculation_formula: Common Equity Tier 1 Capital / Risk-Weighted Assets
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for financial services
metrics.business_value: Enables financial services organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Assets Under Management (AUM)
metrics.description: Represents the total market value of assets that a financial institution manages on behalf of its clients. It's a key metric for asset management firms, indicating growth and market share.
metrics.calculation_formula: Sum of all client assets at market value
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for financial services
metrics.business_value: Enables financial services organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Fee Income Ratio
metrics.description: Measures the proportion of a financial institution's total revenue that comes from non-interest sources, such as service charges, advisory fees, and trading income. It indicates diversification of revenue streams.
metrics.calculation_formula: Non-Interest Income / Total Operating Income
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for financial services
metrics.business_value: Enables financial services organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Efficiency Ratio
metrics.description: Measures a bank's overhead expenses as a percentage of its revenue. A lower ratio indicates better operational efficiency.
metrics.calculation_formula: Non-Interest Expense / (Net Interest Income + Non-Interest Income)
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for financial services
metrics.business_value: Enables financial services organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Risk-Adjusted Return on Capital (RAROC)
metrics.description: Measures the profitability of a financial activity or business unit relative to the economic capital required to support it, adjusted for risk. It helps in capital allocation decisions.
metrics.calculation_formula: Risk-Adjusted Income / Economic Capital
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for financial services
metrics.business_value: Enables financial services organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Cybersecurity Incident Rate
metrics.description: Measures the frequency of cybersecurity breaches or incidents within a financial institution. It indicates the effectiveness of cybersecurity defenses and risk management.
metrics.calculation_formula: Number of Cybersecurity Incidents / Total Number of Systems or Transactions (or per period)
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for financial services
metrics.business_value: Enables financial services organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Customer Lifetime Value (CLTV)
metrics.description: Predicts the total revenue a financial institution can reasonably expect from a customer throughout their relationship. It helps in understanding the long-term value of customer relationships.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Average Purchase Value * Average Purchase Frequency * Average Customer Lifespan) - Customer Acquisition Cost
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for financial services
metrics.business_value: Enables financial services organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

9.0.category_description: This category encompasses processes associated with acquiring, constructing, maintaining, and disposing of both productive and nonproductive assets to support organizational operations and strategic objectives.
process_groups: 9.3 Obtain and install assets, equipment, and tools
9.4 Dispose of productive and nonproductive assets
9.0.category_relationships: Closely related to 8.4 Manage fixed-asset project accounting for financial tracking and 4.0 Deliver Products and Services for productive asset utilization

metrics.name: Return on fixed assets
metrics.description: Measures the return generated from fixed assets relative to their cost and total cost of ownership
metrics.calculation_formula: (Net income from assets / Total fixed asset investment) × 100
metrics.purpose: To assess the effectiveness of asset investment and management decisions
metrics.business_value: Enables optimization of asset portfolio and investment decisions

metrics.name: Cost of managing fixed assets
metrics.description: Measures the total cost of managing fixed assets including accounting, tracking, maintenance planning, responsibility assignment, data gathering, and physical inventory
metrics.calculation_formula: Sum of all asset management costs (accounting + tracking + maintenance planning + administration + inventory)
metrics.purpose: To assess the efficiency of asset management operations and identify cost optimization opportunities
metrics.business_value: Enables cost control and optimization of asset management processes

metrics.name: Liquidity Ratio
metrics.description: Measures the company's ability to meet its short-term financial obligations. It indicates the availability of unrestricted cash and current assets relative to current liabilities, which is crucial for navigating unexpected shifts in cash flow.
metrics.calculation_formula: Current Assets / Current Liabilities
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for energy & utilities
metrics.business_value: Enables energy & utilities organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Debt Service Coverage Ratio (DSCR)
metrics.description: Assesses a company's capacity to cover its debt obligations with its available cash flow. Lenders use this metric to evaluate financing decisions, and a low DSCR can hinder access to capital for new projects.
metrics.calculation_formula: Net Operating Income / Total Debt Service
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for energy & utilities
metrics.business_value: Enables energy & utilities organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Return on Rate Base
metrics.description: Measures how much the rate base (assets determining utility rates) returns on investment. This KPI is central to understanding a utility's revenue requirements and asset management effectiveness.
metrics.calculation_formula: Net Operating Income / Rate Base
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for energy & utilities
metrics.business_value: Enables energy & utilities organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Cost of Capital
metrics.description: Determines the weighted average cost of all capital sources (debt and equity). It helps decision-makers select fiscally viable options for major investments and influences most financial and operational decisions.
metrics.calculation_formula: Weighted Average Cost of Debt + Weighted Average Cost of Equity
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for energy & utilities
metrics.business_value: Enables energy & utilities organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Debt-to-Equity Ratio
metrics.description: Indicates the proportion of debt versus equity used to finance a company's operations. Utilities often have high ratios due to infrastructure costs, making effective monitoring essential to manage interest rate risk.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total Debt / Shareholder Equity
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for energy & utilities
metrics.business_value: Enables energy & utilities organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Interest Coverage Ratio
metrics.description: Measures a company's ability to meet its interest obligations on outstanding debt. A higher ratio signifies better financial stability and attractiveness to investors.
metrics.calculation_formula: Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) / Interest Expense
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for energy & utilities
metrics.business_value: Enables energy & utilities organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Capital Expenditure (CapEx) Efficiency
metrics.description: Measures the efficiency of capital expenditures by comparing spending on projects to the returns generated. Essential for ensuring effective use of funds in infrastructure-heavy utilities.
metrics.calculation_formula: Return Generated from CapEx / Amount Spent on CapEx
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for energy & utilities
metrics.business_value: Enables energy & utilities organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Net Profit Margin
metrics.description: Measures the percentage of revenue remaining as profit after all expenses. It's a key indicator of overall financial health and operational efficiency, reflecting effective cost management.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Net Income / Revenue) * 100
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for energy & utilities
metrics.business_value: Enables energy & utilities organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Non-Fuel Operation and Maintenance Costs
metrics.description: Tracks the costs associated with running energy systems, excluding fuel costs. This provides a clearer picture of operational efficiency without the volatility of fuel prices.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total O&M Costs - Fuel Costs
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for energy & utilities
metrics.business_value: Enables energy & utilities organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Non-fuel O&M per Megawatt Hour Sold (MWh)
metrics.description: Measures the cost of operating and maintaining power plants per megawatt-hour of electricity sold. This metric highlights the cost-effectiveness of electricity delivery.
metrics.calculation_formula: Non-Fuel O&M Costs / MWh Sold
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for energy & utilities
metrics.business_value: Enables energy & utilities organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Service Interruptions
metrics.description: Measures the number and duration of service interruptions. This KPI is vital for identifying and addressing issues causing disruptions, ensuring grid reliability, and maintaining customer trust.
metrics.calculation_formula: Number of Interruptions / Total Customers Served; Duration of Interruptions (minutes/hours)
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for energy & utilities
metrics.business_value: Enables energy & utilities organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Capacity Factor
metrics.description: Represents the efficiency with which a power plant generates electricity, calculated as the ratio of actual output to maximum possible output over a period. It's a key operational metric for power generation.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Actual Energy Output / Maximum Possible Energy Output) * 100
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for energy & utilities
metrics.business_value: Enables energy & utilities organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Return on Investment (ROI)
metrics.description: Measures the profitability of an investment, indicating how well an investment has performed.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Net Profit / Total Investment) * 100%
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for construction & real estate
metrics.business_value: Enables construction & real estate organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for construction & real estate

metrics.name: Payback Period
metrics.description: Determines the number of years it will take for a property to pay back the initial investment amount.
metrics.calculation_formula: Initial Capital Cost for Project / Annual Savings or Earnings from Project
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for construction & real estate
metrics.business_value: Enables construction & real estate organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for construction & real estate

metrics.measurement_frequency: Before and after purchasing an investment property (e.g., annually for review)

metrics.name: Tenant Turnover
metrics.description: The rate at which tenants are leaving a property. A low turnover rate is desirable as it means the property is occupied and generating income.
metrics.calculation_formula: (# of Tenants Moved Out / Total # of Tenants) * 100%
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for construction & real estate
metrics.business_value: Enables construction & real estate organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for construction & real estate

metrics.name: Operating Expense Ratio
metrics.description: Compares operational costs to rental income, indicating how much it costs to manage and maintain properties.
metrics.calculation_formula: ((Total Operating Expenses – Depreciation) / Gross Revenue) * 100%
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for construction & real estate
metrics.business_value: Enables construction & real estate organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for construction & real estate

metrics.name: Loan to Value (LTV) Ratio
metrics.description: Used by lenders to determine required down payment on a mortgage application, comparing the mortgage amount to the appraised property value.
metrics.calculation_formula: Mortgage Amount / Appraised Property Value
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for construction & real estate
metrics.business_value: Enables construction & real estate organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for construction & real estate

metrics.measurement_frequency: At financing, periodically for refinancing assessment

metrics.name: Year-over-Year (YoY) Variance of Average Sold Price
metrics.description: Assesses regional market conditions by tracking the percentage change in average sold price year-over-year.
metrics.calculation_formula: ((Current Year Avg. Price - Previous Year Avg. Price) / Previous Year Avg. Price) * 100%
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for construction & real estate
metrics.business_value: Enables construction & real estate organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for construction & real estate

metrics.name: Number of Days on Market
metrics.description: Measures how long properties remain on the market before being sold, indicating market liquidity and pricing effectiveness.
metrics.calculation_formula: Average number of days from listing to sale
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for construction & real estate
metrics.business_value: Enables construction & real estate organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for construction & real estate

metrics.name: Number of accidents
metrics.description: Tracks the frequency of accidents on construction sites, crucial for safety management.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total number of reported accidents
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for construction & real estate
metrics.business_value: Enables construction & real estate organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for construction & real estate

metrics.name: Cost per square foot
metrics.description: Measures the cost efficiency of construction projects based on the area built.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total Project Cost / Total Square Footage
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for construction & real estate
metrics.business_value: Enables construction & real estate organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for construction & real estate

metrics.units: Currency per square foot (e.g., USD/sq ft)
metrics.measurement_frequency: Per project, or quarterly for overall assessment

metrics.name: Percentage of work completed on schedule
metrics.description: Assesses adherence to project timelines and schedule efficiency.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Actual Work Completed / Planned Work) * 100%
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for construction & real estate
metrics.business_value: Enables construction & real estate organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for construction & real estate

metrics.name: Amount of rework required
metrics.description: Quantifies the volume of work that needs to be redone due to errors or quality issues.
metrics.calculation_formula: Cost of Rework / Total Project Cost * 100% (or hours spent on rework)
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for construction & real estate
metrics.business_value: Enables construction & real estate organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for construction & real estate

metrics.name: Profit margin - Actual versus baseline profit margin over project timeline
metrics.description: Compares the actual profit margin achieved against the planned or baseline profit margin for a project.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Actual Profit / Actual Revenue) * 100% vs. (Baseline Profit / Baseline Revenue) * 100%
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for construction & real estate
metrics.business_value: Enables construction & real estate organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for construction & real estate

metrics.name: Labor productivity
metrics.description: Measures the efficiency of labor in terms of output per unit of labor input.
metrics.calculation_formula: Output (e.g., square feet built) / Labor Hours
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for construction & real estate
metrics.business_value: Enables construction & real estate organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for construction & real estate

metrics.name: Material waste percentage
metrics.description: Tracks the amount of material wasted during construction as a percentage of total material used.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Weight or Cost of Wasted Material / Total Weight or Cost of Material Used) * 100%
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for construction & real estate
metrics.business_value: Enables construction & real estate organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for construction & real estate

11.0.category_description: This category encompasses processes related to establishing and maintaining relationships with external entities such as investors, government bodies, industry groups, boards of directors, and the public. It includes managing legal and ethical issues, and public relations programs.
process_groups: 11.3 Manage relations with board of directors
11.0.category_relationships: Supports strategic objectives from 1.0 Develop Vision and Strategy, coordinates with 8.0 Manage Financial Resources for investor relations, and aligns with all operational processes for compliance and public relations

metrics.name: Investor satisfaction score
metrics.description: Measures the satisfaction level of investors with organizational performance and communication
metrics.calculation_formula: Average satisfaction rating from investor surveys and feedback
metrics.purpose: To assess the effectiveness of investor relations and communication strategies
metrics.business_value: Maintains investor confidence and supports access to capital markets

12.0.category_description: This category encompasses all processes required to build, maintain, and improve organizational capabilities across multiple domains including process management, portfolio/program/project management, quality management, change management, knowledge management, and measurement/benchmarking.
process_groups: 12.5 Develop and manage enterprise-wide knowledge management capability
12.0.category_relationships: Foundational category that supports capability development across all other categories, closely integrated with 1.0 Develop Vision and Strategy for strategic alignment

metrics.name: Measure of process compliance
metrics.description: Measures the degree to which organizational processes are being followed and adhered to according to established standards and procedures
metrics.calculation_formula: (Number of compliant process instances / Total process instances) × 100
metrics.purpose: To ensure employees follow established processes and maintain process integrity across the organization
metrics.business_value: Ensures consistent execution of processes, reduces variability, and maintains quality standards

metrics.name: Measure of process maturity
metrics.description: Assessment of how well-developed and sophisticated the organization's processes are in terms of definition, management, and continuous improvement
metrics.calculation_formula: Maturity assessment using standardized maturity models (e.g., CMMI, BPMM)
metrics.purpose: To evaluate the sophistication and effectiveness of process management capabilities
metrics.business_value: Guides process improvement efforts and indicates organizational capability level

metrics.name: Automation rate
metrics.description: Percentage of automated events
metrics.calculation_formula: Calculated using SIGNAL code in Signavio Process Intelligence
metrics.purpose: Process mining metric to analyze automation in business processes
metrics.business_value: Enables optimization of automation through data-driven insights

metrics.name: Automation rate potential
metrics.description: Percentage of events that could be automated
metrics.calculation_formula: Calculated using SIGNAL code in Signavio Process Intelligence
metrics.purpose: Process mining metric to analyze automation in business processes
metrics.business_value: Enables optimization of automation through data-driven insights

metrics.name: Average rate over events
metrics.description: Percentage of automated events
metrics.calculation_formula: Calculated using SIGNAL code in Signavio Process Intelligence
metrics.purpose: Process mining metric to analyze automation in business processes
metrics.business_value: Enables optimization of automation through data-driven insights

metrics.name: Average number of changes per case
metrics.description: Average number of change events per case
metrics.calculation_formula: Calculated using SIGNAL code in Signavio Process Intelligence
metrics.purpose: Process mining metric to analyze change management in business processes
metrics.business_value: Enables optimization of change management through data-driven insights

metrics.name: Percentage of cases with changes
metrics.description: Percentage of cases that contain change events
metrics.calculation_formula: Calculated using SIGNAL code in Signavio Process Intelligence
metrics.purpose: Process mining metric to analyze change management in business processes

metrics.name: Gross Profit Margin
metrics.description: Highlights the profitability of a pharmacy. While not the sole goal, profitability is crucial for business survival.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Net Sales – Cost of Pharmaceutical Goods Sold) / Net Sales
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for pharmaceutical & biotechnology
metrics.business_value: Enables pharmaceutical & biotechnology organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Average Revenue per Customer
metrics.description: Measures the amount of money each customer brings to the pharmacy, providing insight into business growth potential and justifying acquisitions.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total Revenue / Number of Customers
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for pharmaceutical & biotechnology
metrics.business_value: Enables pharmaceutical & biotechnology organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Pharmaceutical Care Plan
metrics.description: Measures the number of patients for whom a comprehensive care plan is developed. This includes patient goals, medical history, allergies, dosing changes, and lab results, improving quality of care and customer retention.
metrics.calculation_formula: Number of patients with a documented, comprehensive pharmaceutical care plan / Total number of patients.
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for pharmaceutical & biotechnology
metrics.business_value: Enables pharmaceutical & biotechnology organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Interprofessional Patient Care
metrics.description: Measures the number of patients involved in interprofessional care, where multiple care providers (pharmacists, family members, healthcare team, caregivers) collaborate to improve medication management.
metrics.calculation_formula: Number of patients receiving interprofessional care / Total number of patients.
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for pharmaceutical & biotechnology
metrics.business_value: Enables pharmaceutical & biotechnology organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Patient Education during Hospital Stay or at Discharge
metrics.description: Measures the number of patients receiving proper information about their illness and medications during hospital stay or at discharge. This helps empower patients for better self-management and reduces readmissions.
metrics.calculation_formula: Number of patients educated on medications and illness / Total number of discharged patients.
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for pharmaceutical & biotechnology
metrics.business_value: Enables pharmaceutical & biotechnology organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Bundled Patient Care Interventions
metrics.description: Counts the number of patients who receive comprehensive patient care from a pharmacist, including all three KPIs mentioned above (care plan, interprofessional care, education). Studies show this leads to more meaningful health improvement.
metrics.calculation_formula: Number of patients receiving bundled care interventions / Total number of patients.
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for pharmaceutical & biotechnology
metrics.business_value: Enables pharmaceutical & biotechnology organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Average Prescriptions Filled per Day
metrics.description: Measures the average number of prescriptions filled daily. This is a vital metric for pharmacy revenue and success. Pharmacies should study trends and set targets accordingly.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total prescriptions filled / Number of operating days.
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for pharmaceutical & biotechnology
metrics.business_value: Enables pharmaceutical & biotechnology organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Transaction Frequency
metrics.description: Measures how often a particular patient makes a purchase. This indicates customer loyalty and helps attract new customers and retain existing ones.
metrics.calculation_formula: Number of purchases / Number of unique customers.
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for pharmaceutical & biotechnology
metrics.business_value: Enables pharmaceutical & biotechnology organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Dispensary Errors and Near Misses
metrics.description: Counts the number of mistakes made by pharmacists and near misses. Medication errors have irreversible consequences, so monitoring this KPI is crucial for patient safety and risk management.
metrics.calculation_formula: Number of dispensary errors + Number of near misses / Total number of prescriptions dispensed.
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for pharmaceutical & biotechnology
metrics.business_value: Enables pharmaceutical & biotechnology organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Medication Reconciliation on Admission and Discharge
metrics.description: Measures the number of patients who receive admission and discharge medication reconciliation by a pharmacist. This ensures medication lists are up-to-date, advancing patient safety and reducing readmissions.
metrics.calculation_formula: Number of successful medication reconciliations / Total number of admissions/discharges requiring reconciliation.
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for pharmaceutical & biotechnology
metrics.business_value: Enables pharmaceutical & biotechnology organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Drug Therapy Problems
metrics.description: Counts the number of drug therapy problems found and addressed by a pharmacist upon patient admission. Common problems include too many prescribed drugs, wrong dosage, adverse drug reactions, inappropriate adherence, or need for additional drugs.
metrics.calculation_formula: Number of drug therapy problems identified and resolved / Total number of patient admissions.
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for pharmaceutical & biotechnology
metrics.business_value: Enables pharmaceutical & biotechnology organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Budgeting Ratio
metrics.description: The ratio of public sector operating cost to its revenue. A rising ratio indicates potential expense mismanagement, while a falling ratio might suggest better expenditure control but also potentially insufficient spending on citizen services.
metrics.calculation_formula: Government Operating Cost / Government Revenue
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for government & public sector
metrics.business_value: Enables government & public sector organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for government & public sector

metrics.name: Revenue Per Capita
metrics.description: The quotient of government revenue divided by the size of its population. A rising revenue per capita indicates the government's ability to expand services, while a falling one signals hindered service delivery.
metrics.calculation_formula: Government Revenue / Population Size
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for government & public sector
metrics.business_value: Enables government & public sector organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for government & public sector

metrics.name: Near-Term Solvency
metrics.description: The ability of the government to meet its short-term financial obligations. A low solvency indicates debt struggles and a need to re-evaluate priorities.
metrics.calculation_formula: Current Assets / Current Liabilities
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for government & public sector
metrics.business_value: Enables government & public sector organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for government & public sector

metrics.name: Debt Per Capita
metrics.description: The quotient of total government debt divided by its population. This measure provides insight into the magnitude of debt relative to the number of residents.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total Government Debt / Population Size
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for government & public sector
metrics.business_value: Enables government & public sector organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for government & public sector

metrics.name: Personnel and Admin Cost Ratio
metrics.description: The ratio of personnel and administrative costs to the total operating cost of the public entity. Labor costs are a significant portion of government spending, and disproportionate changes can impact service delivery.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Personnel Costs + Administrative Costs) / Total Operating Cost
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for government & public sector
metrics.business_value: Enables government & public sector organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for government & public sector

metrics.name: Bond Rating
metrics.description: A measure of the financial stability and credit quality of the government entity. A high bond rating indicates low interest rates for borrowing.
metrics.calculation_formula: Assigned by private rating services based on financial health, economic outlook, and debt management.
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for government & public sector
metrics.business_value: Enables government & public sector organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for government & public sector

metrics.measurement_frequency: Annually/As needed for new bond issues

metrics.name: Regulatory Practices Quality
metrics.description: A measure for improving new and existing public sector practices, enhancing transparency and communication between public entities and citizens. It involves regulatory impact analysis, assessment of regulatory alternatives, consultation with affected parties, and plain language drafting requirements.
metrics.calculation_formula: Qualitative assessment based on adherence to best practices in regulatory development and implementation, potentially using a scoring system.
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for government & public sector
metrics.business_value: Enables government & public sector organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for government & public sector

metrics.name: Housing Opportunity Index
metrics.description: A measure of housing affordability, expressed as a percentage. It is calculated by dividing the number of homes that were affordable to families earning median income by the total number of homes.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Number of affordable homes for median income families / Total number of homes) * 100
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for government & public sector
metrics.business_value: Enables government & public sector organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for government & public sector

metrics.name: Number of Chronically Homeless Individuals
metrics.description: A measure of success in implementation of programs aimed to reduce homelessness. A low number of chronically homeless individuals demonstrates that the region enjoys a healthier lifestyle.
metrics.calculation_formula: Count of individuals identified as chronically homeless within a defined geographic area.
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for government & public sector
metrics.business_value: Enables government & public sector organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for government & public sector

metrics.name: Passenger Trips Per Gallon of Fuel (Public Transit)
metrics.description: A measure of municipal bus service value, providing insight into the quality of transportation services. Analyzing this metric allows the government to allocate resources where they are most needed.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total Passenger Trips / Total Gallons of Fuel Consumed by Public Transit Fleet
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for government & public sector
metrics.business_value: Enables government & public sector organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for government & public sector

metrics.name: Landfill Diversion Rate
metrics.description: A measure of effective waste recycling. It is calculated by dividing the portion of waste that has successfully been rerouted, by the total amount of collected waste. An increase in this metric demonstrates the government's success in preserving the environment and creating a more sustainable waste management system.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Recycled Waste + Composted Waste + Reused Waste) / Total Waste Collected
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for government & public sector
metrics.business_value: Enables government & public sector organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for government & public sector

metrics.name: Total Miles of Municipal Streets Paved
metrics.description: A measure of the government's ability to upgrade and maintain infrastructure to meet the needs of a growing population.
metrics.calculation_formula: Sum of miles of new or repaved municipal streets.
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for government & public sector
metrics.business_value: Enables government & public sector organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for government & public sector

metrics.name: Percentage of Bridges with Sufficient Rating
metrics.description: A measure of the government's ability to maintain the current infrastructure. Governments must regularly assess bridges to ensure they meet sufficiency standards developed by the Federal Highway Administration (FHA).
metrics.calculation_formula: (Number of bridges meeting sufficiency standards / Total number of bridges) * 100
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for government & public sector
metrics.business_value: Enables government & public sector organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for government & public sector

metrics.name: Capital Projects Timely and On-Budget Completion
metrics.description: A measure of the government's ability to successfully plan and execute projects. It should be tracked individually and for all public sector developments. Completing projects on time and on-budget directly relates to the operating cost.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Number of projects completed on time and within budget / Total number of projects) * 100
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for government & public sector
metrics.business_value: Enables government & public sector organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

benchmark_standards.description: Industry-specific benchmarks for government & public sector

metrics.name: Average Hospital Stay
metrics.description: This healthcare KPI tracks the average length of time patients stay in the hospital. While this metric is very useful, it is also very general. To get a higher resolution image of what is happening at the hospital, patients should be grouped by their treatment type. For example, recovering from heart surgery will always require a longer stay than treating a sprained wrist or ankle. An average hospital stay by treatment type will enable hospital staff to identify outliers that may be a result of unseen complications.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total Stay Duration / Total Number of Stays
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for healthcare
metrics.business_value: Enables healthcare organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Bed or Room Turnover
metrics.description: This is a healthcare KPI that tracks how quickly patients are moving in and out of the facility. This metric should be tracked in conjunction with readmission rates to ensure patients are not being discharged prematurely, only to be readmitted again.
metrics.calculation_formula: Number of Discharges (including deaths) / Number of Beds
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for healthcare
metrics.business_value: Enables healthcare organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Medical Equipment Utilization
metrics.description: This modern healthcare metric measures the utilization of advanced equipment at your facility. This is a key metric to help control expenses as specialized equipment carries a heavy price tag. On the flip side, equipment being over utilized can lead to increased maintenance expenditures and unexpected downtime, leading to treatment delays.
metrics.calculation_formula: Usage Hours / Available Hours
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for healthcare
metrics.business_value: Enables healthcare organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Patient Drug Cost Per Stay
metrics.description: This is a modern healthcare metric that is often overlooked by hospital managers. Many drugs have high price tags associated with them. If your staff are not conscious of this, they could end up administering something that the patient cannot afford, or something that their insurance plan does not cover. This could in turn result in a higher-than-expected write-down for the hospital if it is not able to collect payment and has also the potential to affect pharma metrics.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total Drug Cost / Number of Stays
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for healthcare
metrics.business_value: Enables healthcare organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Average Treatment Charge
metrics.description: This performance indicator shows the average amount a hospital charges for treatment. This indicator best gauges the effectiveness and efficiency of the treatments provided by your facility. This metric can be broken down by treatment type or even by treatment category. Average treatment charge is an excellent measure to use when looking to reduce hospital costs.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total Treatment Charges / Number of Treatments
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for healthcare
metrics.business_value: Enables healthcare organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Insurance Claim Processing Time
metrics.description: This healthcare performance metric monitors the amount of time associated with processing insurance claims. Different insurers can take varying amounts of time to issue payment to your facility; it is vital to track this for cash flow and accounts receivable (AR) management.
metrics.calculation_formula: Average Time to Process Claims
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for healthcare
metrics.business_value: Enables healthcare organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Claims Denial Rate
metrics.description: Most healthcare costs are typically paid by insurance providers. However, there are instances in which the insurance provider sees reason not to pay. Typically, institutions should be looking for a claims denial rate below five percent. A low claims-denial rate means that the organization has more time to focus on patient care and spends less time on paperwork.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Number of Denied Claims / Total Number of Claims) * 100
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for healthcare
metrics.business_value: Enables healthcare organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Operating Cash Flow
metrics.description: This healthcare financial metric measures the amount of money that is generated from normal operations at the hospital or clinic.
metrics.calculation_formula: EBIT + Depreciation – Taxes – Change in Working Capital
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for healthcare
metrics.business_value: Enables healthcare organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Readmission Rates
metrics.description: This tracks the percentage of patients that are admitted to the hospital for the same condition or complication they were originally admitted for. Higher hospital readmission rates can indicate that physicians and other care providers are not delivering the proper care to patients, whereas lower hospital readmission rates indicate a strong quality of care. This metric should be used in conjunction with the error rate and training per department to help identify what drives the readmission rates.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Number of Readmissions / Number of Discharges) * 100
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for healthcare
metrics.business_value: Enables healthcare organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Childhood Immunization Rate
metrics.description: This healthcare metric measures the number of children who have received immunizations. This is particularity important as it can be treated as a measure of general populous herd immunity. Herd immunity is important for care facilities as it reduces the strain on your care centers and frees up resources to treat other illnesses.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Number of Children Immunized / Total Number of Children) * 100
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for healthcare
metrics.business_value: Enables healthcare organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Average Daily Rate (ADR)
metrics.description: Room revenue earned per occupied room, revealing the effectiveness of pricing strategy and market positioning.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total room revenue / Number of rooms sold
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for hospitality & tourism
metrics.business_value: Enables hospitality & tourism organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Gross Operating Profit (GOP)
metrics.description: Total revenue minus all operating expenses, offering a clear snapshot of the hotel’s financial performance.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total Revenue - All Operating Expenses
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for hospitality & tourism
metrics.business_value: Enables hospitality & tourism organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Cost Per Occupied Room (CPOR)
metrics.description: The cost to maintain and service each occupied room, helping pinpoint operational inefficiencies.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total room-related operating expenses / Number of occupied rooms
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for hospitality & tourism
metrics.business_value: Enables hospitality & tourism organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Average Room Rate (ARR)
metrics.description: Captures revenue from all booking types, including package deals and special promotions, beyond introductory room rates.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total room revenue (including all package and promotional deals) / Number of rooms sold
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for hospitality & tourism
metrics.business_value: Enables hospitality & tourism organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Revenue Per Available Room (RevPAR)
metrics.description: Combines occupancy and rate performance into one powerful metric, measuring revenue generation efficiency.
metrics.calculation_formula: Occupancy Rate * ADR OR Total room revenue / Total available rooms
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for hospitality & tourism
metrics.business_value: Enables hospitality & tourism organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance
metrics.units: Currency per available room (e.g., USD/available room)

metrics.name: Gross Operating Profit Per Available Room (GOPPAR)
metrics.description: Provides a more comprehensive view of hotel performance than RevPAR by factoring in all revenue streams and operational costs.
metrics.calculation_formula: Gross Operating Profit / Total number of available rooms
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for hospitality & tourism
metrics.business_value: Enables hospitality & tourism organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance
metrics.units: Currency per available room (e.g., USD/available room)

metrics.name: RevPAR Room Type Index (ReRTI)
metrics.description: Measures the RevPAR performance of a specific room type relative to the overall property or market, indicating which room types are performing best.
metrics.calculation_formula: (RevPAR of a specific room type / Overall property RevPAR) * 100 OR (RevPAR of a specific room type / Market segment RevPAR) * 100
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for hospitality & tourism
metrics.business_value: Enables hospitality & tourism organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Revenue Generation Index (RGI)
metrics.description: Compares a hotel's RevPAR to the average RevPAR of its competitive set, indicating market share and competitive performance.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Hotel RevPAR / Competitive Set RevPAR) * 100
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for hospitality & tourism
metrics.business_value: Enables hospitality & tourism organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Market Penetration Index (MPI)
metrics.description: Measures a hotel's occupancy rate relative to the average occupancy rate of its competitive set, indicating how well the hotel is capturing its fair share of the market.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Hotel Occupancy Rate / Competitive Set Occupancy Rate) * 100
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for hospitality & tourism
metrics.business_value: Enables hospitality & tourism organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Marketing Cost Per Booking (MCPB)
metrics.description: The average cost incurred to acquire a single booking, helping to assess the efficiency of marketing efforts.
metrics.calculation_formula: Total Marketing Spend / Number of Bookings
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for hospitality & tourism
metrics.business_value: Enables hospitality & tourism organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Environmental Social Governance (ESG) Score
metrics.description: A measure of a hotel's performance in environmental, social, and governance factors, reflecting its sustainability and ethical practices.
metrics.calculation_formula: Varies by ESG rating agency; typically a composite score based on various criteria (e.g., energy consumption, waste management, labor practices, community engagement).
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for hospitality & tourism
metrics.business_value: Enables hospitality & tourism organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Direct Booking Ratio
metrics.description: The percentage of bookings received directly through the hotel's own channels (website, phone) versus third-party channels (OTAs), indicating channel efficiency and cost savings.
metrics.calculation_formula: (Number of Direct Bookings / Total Number of Bookings) * 100
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for hospitality & tourism
metrics.business_value: Enables hospitality & tourism organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance

metrics.name: Sentiment Score
metrics.description: A measure of overall guest satisfaction and perception based on online reviews, social media mentions, and surveys, reflecting brand reputation and guest experience.
metrics.calculation_formula: Aggregated score from sentiment analysis tools, often on a scale (e.g., 1-5 or 1-100).
metrics.purpose: Industry-specific performance measurement for hospitality & tourism
metrics.business_value: Enables hospitality & tourism organizations to benchmark against industry standards and optimize performance
